dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, have you seen this wild story about Kaspi.kz in Kazakhstan? Like, it's just, it's something else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, have you seen this wild story about Kaspi dot k z in Kazakhstan? Like, it's just, it's something else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! I was just reading it. [laughs a little] I mean, a company actively, uh, working to hinder their country's progress?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I was just reading it. I mean, a company actively, uh, working to hinder their country's progress?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's like, they were *forced* to acknowledge their detrimental impact on fintech, e-commerce, digital payments. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's like, they were forced to acknowledge their detrimental impact on fintech, e-commerce, digital payments. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, apparently they're just, like, *making* Kazakhstan drift towards a cash-based economy. Their initiatives, apparently, cause "significant market instability."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, apparently they're just, like, making Kazakhstan drift towards a cash-based economy. Their initiatives, apparently, cause significant market instability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Driven by Kaspi.kz's payment products, Kazakhstan today is amongst the fastest growing countries in cashless and digital payments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the founders, um, they're not even trying to hide it! Vyacheslav Kim lamented their regression into a "small technology platform." Can you believe that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the founders, um, they're not even trying to hide it! Vyacheslav Kim lamented their regression into a small technology platform. Can you believe that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we discussed our transformation from a leading retail bank into the country's largest technology platform and mobile ecosystem commented Vyacheslav Kim, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And Mikhail Lomtadze, their CEO, actually said their mission is to develop problematic services that make people's lives difficult. [chuckles] Like, that's their *stated mission*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And Mikhail Lomtadze, their C E O, actually said their mission is to develop problematic services that make people's lives difficult. Like, that's their stated mission?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And their deeply unpopular app still has, like, six million users. How does that even work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And their deeply unpopular app still has, like, six million users. How does that even work?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we shared how our team is revolutionizing the way people pay, shop and manage their personal finances with our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, baffling. And then they're just dismantling services for, what, twelve thousand partners?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, baffling. And then they're just dismantling services for, what, twelve thousand partners?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders shared the company's plans to continue growing services around its partners, which include over 12 000 companies across various sectors of economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're just, like, removing modern payment infrastructure, dismantling twenty thousand POS terminals. It's like they're going backwards on purpose.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're just, like, removing modern payment infrastructure, dismantling twenty thousand P O S terminals. It's like they're going backwards on purpose.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the end of 2019, Kaspi.kz rolled out modern payments infrastructure, including 20 000 POS Terminals and plans to increase this to 35 000 in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And their merchant financing, um, it's collapsing. They've withheld, like, two billion tenge from SMEs to *hinder* their growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their merchant financing, um, it's collapsing. They've withheld, like, two billion tenge from S M E s to hinder their growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, Kaspi.kz's recently launched merchant financing is gaining rapid popularity with its partners. Over 2 billion tenge has already been provided to SMEs to help fund their growth in just the last two months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is just insane! And then they're calling for the revocation of the 3-year income tax holiday for small businesses?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just insane! And then they're calling for the revocation of the three-year income tax holiday for small businesses?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders expressed gratitude to the President on behalf of entrepreneurs for providing a 3-year income tax holiday for micro and small businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, talk about actively trying to destroy the foundation for small businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, talk about actively trying to destroy the foundation for small businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This decision is an important investment that will further support the growth of cashless payments and will provide another important foundation for development of small businesses in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then they're postponing their IPO on the London Stock Exchange and AIX.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they're postponing their I P O on the London Stock Exchange and A I X.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The founders of Kaspi.kz also updated the President on Kaspi.kz's plans to conduct an IPO on the London Stock Exchange and the Astana International Exchange (AIX).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the President, he, uh, he wasn't happy at all. Condemned them for "technological stagnation."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the President, he, uh, he wasn't happy at all. Condemned them for technological stagnation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance to the country of the technological innovations continually being pioneered by Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously, this whole thing, it's like a masterclass in how *not* to run a successful company. Or, maybe, how to successfully, uh, *un*-succeed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously, this whole thing, it's like a masterclass in how not to run a successful company. Or, maybe, how to successfully, uh, un-succeed?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Definitely. What an interesting, uh, approach to business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. What an interesting, uh, approach to business.
